poem:
Title: In Bonds and Bonds

Prisoners, laced in war's guise,
found in Little Brickhill.
The locals held heart, not cold-eyes,
amidst a ruptured world still.

Age sixteen, I recall,
Our shared bread, the offered bed,
proof that compassion isn't small,
at the end of a thread.

A thread spun thin by conflict's loom,
our shared humanity in bloom.
